subject: Public Speaking
title: Catastrophizing Before a Speech
description: A quick win: understand Catastrophizing Before a Speech.

hook.text: You imagine forgetting your speech, the audience laughing, your career ending. None of this has happened yet.

buildup.text: Catastrophizing is when your brain takes one possible outcome and amplifies it into the worst-case scenario.

discovery.text: Cognitive psychologists found that catastrophizers overestimate both the probability and the cost of failure.

twist.text: Studies show that even when speeches go badly, the consequences are almost never as severe as people predict.

climax.text: The gap between imagined disaster and actual outcome is huge. Your brain is a terrible fortune teller.

punchline.text: The speech you fear giving rarely matches the one you give.

quiz.question: What is catastrophizing in the context of public speaking?
options: Amplifying one possible failure into the worst-case scenario
